LanguageData.TD.ToggleCoverage: Toggle the building coverage overlay (shown when selected buildings have coverage)
LanguageData.TD.SettingOverlayBuildable: Enable a toggle for a buildable terrain overlay
LanguageData.TD.SettingOverlayBuildableDesc: Red is unbuildable terrain, Orange is 'Medium', Yellow is 'Light', and clear is 'Heavy' (pretty much everything can be built on 'Heavy')
LanguageData.TD.SettingOverlayCoverage: Enable a toggle for a building coverage overlay
LanguageData.TD.SettingOverlayCoverageDesc: Buildings like trade beacons show their collective range when selected
LanguageData.TD.SettingOverlayBeauty: Enable a toggle for a beauty overlay
LanguageData.TD.SettingOverlayFertility: Enable a toggle for a fertility overlay
LanguageData.TD.SettingOverlayFertilityUnder: Fertility overlay shows value for terrain under floors
LanguageData.TD.SettingOverlayWalkSpeed: Enable a toggle for a walkspeed overlay
LanguageData.TD.SettingOverlayLighting: Enable a toggle for a lighting overlay
LanguageData.TD.SettingOverlayPlantHarvest: Enable a toggle for a harvest overlay
LanguageData.TD.SettingTradeClose: Set speed after closing trade or negotiation dialog
LanguageData.TD.SettingResearchingArrow: Show arrow indicating research in progress
LanguageData.TD.SettingSkillLossArrowDesc: Skills slowly lose experience after level 10 (The arrow can be very faded for slow rates)
LanguageData.TD.SettingZoneSize: Show Stockpile/Growing zone area size and info
LanguageData.TD.SettingZoneSizeDesc: Growing zones show count of empty / mature plots. The "Fertile" count is the approximate equivalent number of 100% fertility land (e.g 100 plots with 140% fertility would yield about the same as 140 at 100% fertiliity) (And this takes into acount plant fertility sensitivity)
LanguageData.TD.AreaEditing: Areas can be reordered, recolored, and copy/pasted in the area manager
LanguageData.TD.NeverHome: Make an area named 'Never Home' and the area will never be added to the Home Area
LanguageData.TD.SlaughterZone: Make an area named 'Slaughter' and the animals will only be slaughtered in that area
LanguageData.TD.RequiresRestart: These require a restart to take effect:
LanguageData.TD.VariousCount: (various) selected items are given a count
LanguageData.TD.RottedAwayClickable: Food 'rotted away' messages are clickable to see where it was
LanguageData.TD.PopupMessageRealtime: Popup messages like '% recruit chance' (text motes) stay onscreen in realtime, so they don't dissappear at high speeds
LanguageData.TD.SettingsIgnoreSleepingDesc: This applies to the 'Attack' Reaction mode. Would you believe your colonists would attack sleeping megascarabs if they happened to haul near them?
LanguageData.TD.StopDescUndrafted: Stop the current job (find another job, which might be the same job)
LanguageData.TD.AllowHarvestingDesc: When disabled, colonists will never harvest plants in this zone. They will still sow.
LanguageData.TD.SettingAllowHarvestingDesc: Also applies to Hydroponics (forbidden status is just for sowing then)
LanguageData.TD.FeatureConditionGreen: Good body conditions are green ; Whole body tag is yellow
LanguageData.TD.DeteriorationAlert: Something is deteriorating and is getting low on health. Put it indoors to keep it safe.
LanguageData.TD.MatchDesc: Add a growing zone, but only add terrain with fertility that matches the first cell picked
LanguageData.TD.SettingStopFlee: Stop fleeing if threat is gone
LanguageData.TD.SettingStopFleeDesc: Pretty sure this works\n\nSetting change doesn't apply to people already fleeing
LanguageData.TD.SettingDodgeGrenadesDesc: Of course this interrupts what you're doing.
LanguageData.TD.SettingDodgeGrenadesUnlessBelt: Don't dodge if shield belt is worn
LanguageData.TD.SettingAutoBuildable: Auto-show buildable terrain overlay when placing buildings
LanguageData.TD.SettingAutoBuildableDesc: Buildings with unique requirements like bridges and graves will show a overlay of where they can't be built
LanguageData.TD.SettingAutoCoverage: Auto-show building coverage overlay when placing buildings
LanguageData.TD.SettingAutoCoverageDesc: Buildings like trade beacons show their collective range
LanguageData.TD.SettingAutoSmoothable: Auto-highlight smoothable terrain when smoothing things
LanguageData.TD.SettingAutoTreeGrowth: Auto-highlight tree growth when ordering wood chopping
LanguageData.TD.SettingAutoTreeGrowthDesc:
Red is unharvestable 
Green is harvestable 
White is fully mature 
Yellow is harvestable "soon"
LanguageData.TD.SettingAutoWindBlocker: Auto-highlight wind-blocking things when placing wind turbines
LanguageData.TD.SettingAutoFertility: Auto-show fertility overlay when placing growing zones
LanguageData.TD.SettingAutoLighting: Auto-show lighting overlay when placing lights
LanguageData.TD.SettingAutoPlantHarvest: Auto-show harvest overlay when ordering plant harvesting
LanguageData.TD.SettingAutoAutorebuild: Autorebuild is on for a new game
LanguageData.TD.CaravanLoadSelection: Forming a caravan pre-selects all the things that are selected on the map
LanguageData.TD.CaravanSaveManifest: Closing the caravan/transport-pod dialog will remember the list of things to send, and opening it again will re-select them
LanguageData.TD.CaravanDesc: *Note: Closing and re-opening with newly selected items won't add them, since the previous selection was saved: Just hit the reset button and re-open the window to get newly selected items.
LanguageData.TD.BlueprintAnyStuff: Right-click a building tool to select any material to build from (even when you don't have it available)
LanguageData.TD.SettingTopRightMouseover: Mouseover tile info is on topright
LanguageData.TD.SettingTopRightMouseoverDesc: So it shows up when something is selected\n\nOf course this is a bad idea if you still have the learning helper on.
LanguageData.TD.SettingPawnTableClickSelect: Mouse clicks in pawn tables select them. (Alt-click to work as before)
LanguageData.TD.SettingPawnTableClickSelectDesc: Should behave intuitively like any other selection. Press Esc to close the tab window.\n\nShift-click to select/deselect multiple. Double click to center camera. Right-click to select a single pawn. Alt-click to close window, select and go to that one pawn.
LanguageData.TD.SettingAlertDeteriorationDesc: Deteriorating things with less than 50% HP, that are not forbidden, and this doesn't include rotting corpses.
LanguageData.TD.SettingAlertBurning: Alert for colonists that are burning
LanguageData.TD.SettingAlertToxic: Alert for colonists that are getting toxic buildup
LanguageData.TD.SettingAlertNoBill: Alert for workbenches with no bills set up
LanguageData.TD.SettingMatchGrow: Enable a tool to make a growing zone that matches terrain
LanguageData.TD.SettingMatchGrowDesc: Terrain is only added if fertility % matches the first tile selected when dragging
LanguageData.TD.DropPodWhatDropped: The letter for random resource drop pods tell you what dropped
LanguageData.TD.SarcophagusPreferred: Sarcophagus preferred to use over graves
LanguageData.TD.SarcophagusPreferredDesc: The default settings for a Sarcophagus are Critical so they are used before graves. The settings are already colonist-only, but without setting Critical, colonists would be buried in closer graves instead
LanguageData.TD.NoFrameDecon: Frames can't be deconstructed, only canceled
LanguageData.TD.NoFrameDeconDesc: Deconstruction would return less resources than canceling
LanguageData.TD.DropdownBuildingsOrder: Dropdown designators get their order set by their contained designators
LanguageData.TD.DropdownBuildingsOrderDesc: e.g. colored lights show up in the build menu next to other lights instead of the front of the list
LanguageData.TD.SmoothSelectedStone: Selected stone has a button to smooth it
LanguageData.TD.DeepDrillRandomrock: Deep drilling for stone gets a random stone type
LanguageData.TD.DeepDrillRandomrockDesc: It would normally only get one type. Now it's random from the stone types available on the map.
LanguageData.TD.SettingUrgentRefill: If you have Allow Tool, stockpiles have an 'urgent refill' toggle
LanguageData.TD.SettingUrgentRefillDesc: If a tile in a chosen stockpile is empty, there will be a urgent hauling job to refill it. Great for kitchen/workbench supplies.\n\nRequires Allow Tool
LanguageData.TD.SettingCameraDragFixDesc:
Dragging attaches the map to the cursor instead of moving at some who-knows-what speed

Dragging at low FPS is not affected

The sliding of the map after mouse is stopped is removed
LanguageData.TD.GizmoUrgentRefillDesc: If any cell is unoccupied, it will be urgently refilled
LanguageData.TD.EmptyWorkbenchDesc: There is a workbench with no work bills set up
LanguageData.TD.ClearEntireArea: Clear entire area (but don't delete from the list)
LanguageData.TD.AlertBurning: A colonist is burning, and is rapidly gaining heatstroke.
LanguageData.TD.AlertHeatstrike: A colonist is gaining heatstroke. That's not a good thing.
LanguageData.TD.AlertToxic: A colonist has non-trivial levels of toxic buildup. That's not a good thing.
LanguageData.TD.SettingRememberResourceReadout: Resource readout state is saved per-game (categorized mode)
LanguageData.TD.SettingNewGameOpenResourceReadout: New game: resource readout starts with each category open
LanguageData.TD.WindBlockedDesc: Something is blocking wind, and you probably don't want it blocking wind
